articles.author: David SchoenfieldESPN Senior Writer
articles.title: Los Angeles Angels' Shohei Ohtani, Mike Trout lead way as MLB announces All-Star Game starters
articles.description: Los Angeles Angels two-way star Shohei Ohtani won a close vote as the AL's starting designated hitter on Friday, when Major League Baseball revealed starters for the July 19 All-Star Game.
articles.content:
In? Shohei Ohtani.
Out? Yordan Alvarez.
At least in the American League starting lineup at designated hitter for the July 19 All-Star Game at Dodger Stadium.
Alvarez, the left-handed slugger for t… [+2015 chars]

articles.author: Blake Baumgartner
articles.title: Defensive tackle Peter Woods, No. 9 prospect in class of 2023, commits to Clemson Tigers
articles.description: Clemson scored its biggest victory thus far in this year's recruiting cycle after landing a commitment from the No. 9 prospect in the 2023 class on Friday - defensive tackle Peter Woods.
articles.content:
Clemson scored its biggest victory thus far in this year's recruiting cycle, courtesy of scoring Peter Woods' commitment on Friday night.
And Woods did it for one simple reason - family.

articles.title: San Diego Padres' Jurickson Profar discharged from hospital, dealing with concussion, neck strain
articles.description: Jurickson Profar was discharged overnight from UC San Diego Health, and the Padres say he is resting.
articles.content:
The San Diego Padres said Friday that left fielder Jurickson Profar has been diagnosed with a concussion and a neck strain suffered in a collision with teammate C.J. Abrams the previous night.
Profa… [+1134 chars]

articles.author: T.J. Quinn
articles.title: WNBA star Brittney Griner's case has raised awareness of Russian detainee Paul Whelan and others held overseas
articles.description: The Whelans say the increased attention to Paul Whelan's case has been reassuring, mostly because they don't want him to be forgotten.
articles.content:
For more than three years, as former U.S. Marine Paul Whelan toiled in a Russian prison labor camp, his family wondered what it would take to keep the public interested in his case.
Once in a while,… [+9121 chars]

articles.title: Damian Lillard reaches 2-year, $122M extension with Portland Trail Blazers, sources say
articles.description: Star point guard Damian Lillard has agreed to a two-year, $122 million contract extension with the Trail Blazers that will tie him to the franchise until 2027, sources told Andscape's Marc J. Spears and ESPN's Bobby Marks.

articles.title: Sources -- MLBPA counters MLB's international draft proposal; sides still far apart
articles.description: The MLPBA has countered MLB's international draft proposal with one that would allocate significantly more money to international players and address pre-draft requirements that the Union considers discriminatory in nature, sources told ESPN.

articles.title: Milwaukee Brewers to honor 8-year-old boy paralyzed during July 4 mass shooting
articles.description: The Milwaukee Brewers will hang a No. 22 'Roberts' jersey in their dugout on Friday night in honor of 8-year-old shooting victim, Cooper Roberts, who was paralyzed from the waist down during a July 4 mass shooting in Highland Park, Illinois.

articles.title: Report - WWE's Vince McMahon paid total of $12M to 4 women to quiet sexual misconduct allegations
articles.description: WWE's Vince McMahon paid out a total of $12 million to four women over the past 16 years to quiet allegations of sexual misconduct, according to a Wall Street Journal report.
